com.isoterik.mgdx.m2d.components.ai.steer

Class SteerableGameObject2d

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.isoterik.mgdx.Component
      • com.isoterik.mgdx.m2d.components.ai.steer.SteerableGameObject2d
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer.Limiter, com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer.Steerable<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2>, com.badlogic.gdx.ai.utils.Location<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2>

    public class SteerableGameObject2d
extends Component
implements com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer.Steerable<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2>
    Attach this component to your GameObjects to make them steerable in 2D space. For this component to be useful, the host GameObject must have Physics2d attached!
    See Also:
    Steerable, SteeringBehavior, Component

    • Constructor Detail

      • SteerableGameObject2d

        public SteerableGameObject2d(GameObject owner,
                             float boundingRadius,
                             boolean independentFacing)
        Creates a new instance given an owner. This component will be attached to the owner if not null.
        Parameters:
        owner - the game object that owns this component
        boundingRadius - the bounding radius of the owner
        independentFacing - if true, the steerable will rely on angular acceleration to get a resultant orientation. Otherwise the steerable will make the host game object to always face the direction where it is going.

      • SteerableGameObject2d

        public SteerableGameObject2d(GameObject owner,
                             float boundingRadius)
        Creates a new instance given an owner. This component will be attached to the owner if not null.
        Parameters:
        owner - the game object that owns this component
        boundingRadius - the bounding radius of the owner

        independentFacing - if true, the steerable will rely on angular acceleration to get a resultant orientation. Otherwise the steerable will make the host game object to always face the direction where it is going.

        Determines if this steerable should apply angular acceleration or not
        Parameters:
        independentFacing - if true, the steerable will rely on angular acceleration to get a resultant orientation. Otherwise the steerable will make the host game object to always face the direction where it is going.

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from class: Component
        Called when the host game object is added to a Scene. If the game object is already added to a scene before this component gets attached, this method will still be called (immediately after Component.attach()) It is safe to make scene related calls here because a Scene instance exists. This is where you will typically do all initializations.
        Overrides:
        start in class Component

      • componentAdded

        public void componentAdded(Component component)
        Description copied from class: Component
        Called when a new component is attached to the host game object. Note: the new component will be added once this method completes and every other component is notified.
        Overrides:
        componentAdded in class Component
        Parameters:
        component - the new component

        public void fixedUpdate(float deltaTime)

        Overrides:
        fixedUpdate in class Component
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - the time difference between the current frame and the previous frame.
